intro: Wibelia apargioides, commonly known as the false bindweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has a deep root system that allows it to thrive in a variety of soil types. Due to its aggressive growth, it is often considered a weed in agricultural and natural settings.
